headline.print_headline: Of Art  and Commerce:  A Mail-Order Tale
headline.main: My Grandfather Was a Famous Artist. He Also Made Greeting Cards.

snippet: A show revisits a company that sold art to ordinary Americans — and sheds light on a writer’s family history.
abstract: Jane Margolies, recounts career of her grandfather, acclaimed artist Samuel L Margolies, whose work is featured in traveling show Art for Every Home: Associated American Artists, 1934-2000 at Grey Art Gallery; notes that while many of his drawings and etchings are held by major museums and coveted by collectors, he also produced banal images for mail-order company Associated American Artists.
